contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Ishikawa District'''|石川郡|Ishikawa-gun}} was a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Ishikawa Prefecture|Ishikawa]], [[Japan]]. As of February 2011, the district had an estimated [[population]] of 51,976 and a [[population density|density]] of 3,830 persons per squire kilometer. The total area was 13.56 km². The day before the dissolution on November 10, 2011, the district had only one town. *[[Nonoichi, Ishikawa|Nonoichi]] On November 11, 2011, the town of Nonoichi gained city status. Ishikawa District was dissolved as a result. ==Towns and villages (At the time of abolition)== *[[Nonoichi, Ishikawa|Nonoichi]] ==Mergers== On February 1, 2005 the following towns and villages from the district merged with the city of [[Mattō, Ishikawa|Mattō]] forming the city of [[Hakusan, Ishikawa|Hakusan]]. *[[Kawachi, Ishikawa|Kawachi]] *[[Mikawa, Ishikawa|Mikawa]] *[[Oguchi, Ishikawa|Oguchi]] *[[Shiramine, Ishikawa|Shiramine]] *[[Torigoe, Ishikawa|Torigoe]] *[[Tsurugi, Ishikawa|Tsurugi]] *[[Yoshinodani, Ishikawa|Yoshinodani]] On November 11, 2011 the remaining town of [[Nonoichi, Ishikawa|Nonoichi]] gained city status. Ishikawa District was dissolved as a result.<ref>[http://www.hokkoku.co.jp/subpage/H20110215103.htm 野々市町5万人達成 11月市制施行] by Hokkoku Shimbun, February 15, 2011{{ja icon}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Ishikawa}} {{coord|36|32|24|N|136|36|36|E|type:landmark_source:kolossus-itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Former districts of Ishikawa Prefecture]] {{Ishikawa-geo-stub}}
